summary: A victim impact statement submitted to Judge Alison J. Nathan opposing Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for bail. The author, a victim of Maxwell, argues that Maxwell poses a flight risk and a danger to the community, and implores the court to keep her incarcerated until trial.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; the letter is addressed to her.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused individual facing trial for crimes related to the sexual abuse of minors; the victim author describes her as a manipulative psychopath who abused her and procured girls for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the person for whom Maxwell procured girls to abuse.

connections.description: Maxwell played a central role in procuring girls for Epstein to abuse, according to the victim's statement.
The author states that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually abused her as a child and was charming and manipulative during the grooming process.

events.title: Victim's Abuse by Maxwell
events.description: The author describes being sexually abused by Ghislaine Maxwell as a child and being groomed by her.

events.title: Renewed Bail Motion
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell filed a renewed motion for bail, which this victim statement opposes.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A victim of Ghislaine Maxwell submitted a formal statement to the court opposing her release on bail.
The victim states Maxwell sexually abused her as a child and played a central role in procuring girls for Jeffrey Epstein to abuse.
The victim characterizes Maxwell as a psychopath who is charming, manipulative, lacks empathy and remorse, and poses a flight risk.
The victim argues Maxwell's privileged lifestyle, history of lying, and willingness to harm others for her own benefit make her a danger to the community.
The document is part of the court record for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
